subject: feat(conventions): add strict naming and consistency rules for imports
body:
Extracted a shared NAMING_CONVENTIONS block appended to both JSON and
Markdown convention content. The rules are prescriptive enough that two
independent AI sessions given the same real-world data should produce
identical titles, labels, arc titles, and property keys â€” enabling
reliable duplicate detection by the merge service.

Key additions:
- Title rules: most widely recognized name, no legal suffixes, no
  honorifics, no abbreviations unless the acronym IS the common name
- Label rules: singular PascalCase, standard vocabulary of 19 common
  labels, broad-over-narrow preference
- Arc title rules: lowercase verb phrases, active voice, present/past
  tense distinction, standard vocabulary of 26 common relationships
- Property rules: camelCase keys, standard vocabulary, typed values
  (real numbers, booleans, ISO dates, arrays instead of CSV strings)
- Deduplication guidance: reuse IDs for same entity, merge aliases,
  no duplicate arcs

Tags: conventions, naming, consistency, import, merge
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: conventions
Semver: minor

title: add strict naming and consistency rules for imports
